name: rag-examples
description: Golden dataset for RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) evaluation

examples.expectedOutput: Items can be returned within 30 days of purchase with a valid receipt for a full refund.
examples.context: Return Policy: All items purchased from our store may be returned within 30 days of the original purchase date. A valid receipt is required for a full refund. Items must be in original condition.

examples.input: How much does the Pro plan cost?
examples.expectedOutput: The Pro plan costs $49 per month or $470 per year with annual billing.
examples.context: Pricing: Basic plan $19/month. Pro plan $49/month or $470/year (annual billing). Enterprise plan: contact sales for custom pricing.

examples.input: What programming languages does the SDK support?
examples.expectedOutput: The SDK supports C#, Python, JavaScript, and Java.
examples.context: SDK Documentation: Our SDK is available for C#, Python, JavaScript, and Java. Each SDK provides full API coverage including authentication, data operations, and streaming.

examples.expectedOutput: The application requires Windows 10 or later, 8 GB RAM minimum, and 2 GB of free disk space.
examples.context: System Requirements: OS: Windows 10 or later, macOS 12+, or Ubuntu 20.04+. RAM: 8 GB minimum, 16 GB recommended. Disk: 2 GB free space required.

examples.expectedOutput: Navigate to Admin > Security > SSO Configuration, enter your Identity Provider metadata URL, and click Save.
examples.context: SSO Setup Guide: 1. Go to Admin > Security > SSO Configuration. 2. Enter your Identity Provider (IdP) metadata URL. 3. Map user attributes (email, name, groups). 4. Click Save and test the connection.

examples.expectedOutput: We offer 99.9% uptime SLA for Pro plans and 99.99% for Enterprise plans.
examples.context: Service Level Agreement: Pro plan includes 99.9% uptime guarantee. Enterprise plan includes 99.99% uptime guarantee. Downtime credits are issued automatically when SLA is not met.

examples.input: How do I export my data?
examples.expectedOutput: Go to Settings > Data Management > Export and select your preferred format (CSV, JSON, or Parquet).
examples.context: Data Export: Navigate to Settings > Data Management > Export. Choose format: CSV, JSON, or Parquet. Exports are processed asynchronously and a download link is emailed when ready.
